Hello to future guests who want to stay at the Vialle Tower Hotel, I think this will be a rather long review for those who have patience ...  I was staying at the hotel for 10 days, the reason that led me to staying at this hotel was it being close to restaurants and the main avenue of the city, and also the reviews of other travelers who always tell it's a new hotel! I found it was cool the idea of being in a very new hotel. It was not the price that make me choose it, because I had more cheapers choice. My original choice was the Hotel Torob√°, I stayed there other times and always enjoyed the hotel, but as they had several conferences in the city the amount charged by torob√° was absurd, more than R $ 3,500.00 which honestly is not worth that value as the hotel has nothing else, is a value usually at a resort in Foz. Upon arriving at the hotel, the next door has a nightclub / restaurant that can not help but be noticed, has a dividing wall which I think leads to the garage, the people who frequently the nightclub and are smokers are up against that wall, talking and smoking. But what caught my attention was the hotel entrance, I arrived on a Sunday night around 20:40 the facade is completely dark, the lighting are weak nothing detrimental to the guests but is a point to be noted, even the because of the hour, it was not that late to be so dark outside... I did the checked in regular, nothing else, the only difference is that they charge the full price on check in and not at check out. They did not ask me if I needed help with the bags. The first room allocated to me was on the 8th floor, almost all rooms are in the same configuration: 2 double beds, bathroom and closet. I think that sleeps 3 comfortably, even 4. When I arrived in the room I called the front desk thinking they had allocated me the wrong room because I was traveling alone, so I would not need 2 double beds, and the reception boy reported me that the configuration of all the rooms are basic the same.  My room was facing the street, I heard much far away the noise of the club. Remember I talked to the hotel entrance was dark? The rooms are too! For the first room that I was in it, the lamp was a little after the entrance, making the fourth end near the second double bed to be a bit darker, if not the lamp on the table, the second double bed to the window would be less enlightened. Keep the window in the head !!!    Bed: Are comfortable, but the sheets were stained, probably by a pen, because it had black spots on the sheet, which was dirty it was the blanket that is in the wardrobe, a more thick white blanket that they make available to guests. It was dirty the impression he gave was that someone peed on it. The headboard was dropping the role, and the circuit breaker of the same head was broken, was not a small broken was the button on and off inside the box, as if someone had pressed too hard, do not know how they not saw and fix this , because I could see from far.    Bathroom: it's very wide, the jet shower water is good, strong, you can put the temperature nice and easy, it does not take long to heat and to cool, the same goes for the sink. But the towels were beginning to tear. They had holes in the towels. Has hairdryer. The only thing that does not have the bathroom and disposable cup. It has a fridge and everything is expensive. Very expensive, a bottle of water is R $ 4.50 the tip is to take a bottle of water in the bag, fill up at the airport and when you reach the hotel go on the market to buy water, soda etc ...    TV with cable channels, it even has a good selection, Warner, Fox ... I missed a hbo.    Air conditioning standard, a split which the wall on which it was installed was stained with some old leak.    Not a hotel so new: it has more than two years at least was what informed to me because the room itself has no hotel information, behind the bedroom door does not have the plant with the map of fire escape and the room had no pen in it. And by the looks of it if they not strengthen the maintenance, and make some new improvements like towels, new bedding covers in over two years at least the rooms will look like they are 10 years ...    Now that comes the interesting part, remember the window I mentioned up there? So after I had dinner, bathing etc ... getting ready to bad, using nightwear I close the curtain that was a little open, had pulled to see the view from the room and see the club are 2 curtains one backout which is the thickest and in the front it there is another curtain a very thin, this thin curtain was burned, as if the iron was too hot .. when I pulled the blackout saw a stain type dust on it, with dark specks ... had turn of the lamp, remember that the room is a little dark and when I turned on the lamp to see what it was, I wish I had not touch the curtain. The blackout was covered in mold and fungus !!!! It was not little. It was musty crowded, and there is a very dangerous differences between mold and fungus, fungus are the first stage and mold and the most dangerous when the fungus is already installed some time it evolves, and if the person is allergic can cause serious damage especially if children or elderly. I went down to speak at the reception, it was already 23:30 just had a guy there, so I inform him that the curtain was full of mold and fungus the reception clerk looks at me with a face that kind you're crazy, I doubt, of course had taken pictures of everything, and showed the camera to him, the receptionist tells me that I will change tomorrow's room and apologizes. And it must have been the rain ... but the window opens out, it does not open to the inside or to the side, being very difficult not impossible to get wet, but still had fungus even in very high part of the curtain .. . which had no window. But meanwhile I sleep with fungus ... So I sent an e-mail from inside the room to the hotel stating what was happening.    Wi-Fi is good, I had no trouble using it, the hotel offers a business center with laptop, but I believe it is paid, because when I saw had to enter a code. The next day I did not sleep at all well, just thinking about the damn curtain, on the next morning I left my suitcase just organized so they could changed me room, it was just to take the the suitcase to the other room. I went down was another person at the front desk, gave good day, and informed that my bags were arranged so exchanged room. I informed that I was the guest of moldy room, the receptionist asks me if I will go out I inform that yes, and then tells me ahh when you come back we exchange you. And I say no! I'll get back tired and my suitcases were ready and just take to another room and when I get back I just find out where the new floor that will be. A simple solution in my view. Ahh yes they did not ask me no excuse for what happened, because it's very common you stay in room full of fungus. When I returned from my trip they had changed me. I was the eighth floor and the next room was on thetwelfth floor. The nearly identical rooms, the difference is that this one had no fungus on the curtain, and had a pen. The view from the window I could see the river.    Breakfast: Nothing fantastic. It is a common breakfast most hotels has. There is nothing wonderful or ordinary about it. They have coffee it is from a machine, bread, milk, yogurt, fruit, scrambled eggs, cheese, bread, jam, cake, juice, on the first day had no water to drink in the cafe, and even bacon, the first I thought that nowhere they would offer some water to guests, even at breakfast but as it had on other days, the water ran out and not repositioned, and I have breakfast 8:00 a negative side of the coffee table, I am a small person and should have several guests staying there are small too, breads and cakes were on top I did not have a good view of breads and cakes, unless I stay on tiptoes, I had to just pick up who was in the front. Maybe the hotel if they have the possibility to modify the coffee table thinking of people with short stature to leave at the same level as the the juices and cold meat would be great! In the days I was there probably had a contracted photographer of the hotel taking pictures of couples.    The hotel has a receptive, only that they are specialized in private tours, went to pick up information and the girl serving there, did not give me much attention, perhaps because I'm alone? She did not bother to show me the tours they had, merely to say that they only did private, that I had to ask how much it cost to make a particular trip. And after I leave a couple of Argentines came in and she gave the most attention ... ce la vie .... But she was helpful marked me a ride to the casino.    Pool: It has a beautiful view, good to admire the Brazil / Paraguay border. The pool water and very cold, they provide towels at the pool, so you have to let it dry there, you can not go down with them.    Sauna: Steam, take your water to hydrate the sauna room has a very strong smell of disinfectant should be eucalyptus but okay.    Academy: It has a gym with new equipment, treadmill, leg press, and some equipment. Nowhere in the hotel they provide free water for guests only at breakfast. At the reception has: a massage chain, a machine pays coffee and biscuit / water / sweet. They have an area for meetings are wide. Now if you have children, they have nothing for them. Absolutely no toy for children, only the pool.    On the sixth floor behind the elevator they have an ironing board and iron for ironing. And only you get down with your clothes and pass it Ahh yes there was already forgetting the 5 day stay, I could not close my door, I slammed the door and it would not close, I called the front desk and appears to me the maintenance guy with batteries in his hand. It was not the lock that had just the battery, but the door had begun to loosen the hinges, as it was time for him to go home, he showed me how to close the door, you had to raise it to close, but the next day he was going to fix. What was actually done.    The hotel restaurant food: Are delicious, comes in good quantity the meal, lunch ordered a steak that was not coming beans, ordered beans and did not charge me anything more for it, even asking in the room only the fries that comes very little.    Overall assessment: the location of it is very good, the everyday I was in the ice cream shop, has wonderful ice cream there, has bars close, Subway, pizza, has a restaurant out of the hotel going to the left, take the first left, walk a few meters through the street, it is a house that has been transformed into restaurant Santa Luzia, which is a sensational Italian! I recommend and the food and wonderful. The hotel itself despite all the problems is not so bad, it is average, has nothing else in the hotel, but the location of it makes him gain some points, but the treatment of some employees (except Jackeline) makes the hotel lose points, the employee Jackeline, and a boy I do not remember his name, but he helped me with the suitcase also not sure if Jackeline it's her name, she is new to the hotel and works at the front desk, she is an exception, it is friendly, attentive and helpful, she is to be congratulated and has a thank you to her. And the boy's suitcase are also friendly. The location .... the key point is: location, location and location. Would I stay again? Yes, but if it was the same price I paid for 10 days, but I have a curiosity to test the hotel Bogari I discovered that it is the owner of Loumar, and it was just renewed also wanted to try the Bella Italia hotel. Then Vialle Tower hotel would end up third on the list. I recommend: For location yes, and if you are the type that almost is not at the hotel, that a hotel only means sleep and hold you suitcases for you. Now if friends with kids I will not recommend. Ahh before finalizing another story aunt has to tell. When I checked out I did around noon, my flight was 19:30 stayed at the hotel until 18:00 was a hot day. The reception was an oven !!! There was no working air conditioner, there are a total of 6 splits at the front desk! I was in the gym there is air and was on, but then came a person to run on the treadmill and I would not stay there looking .... I went down and asked the front desk to connect the air, there were two receptionists one of them was even fanning himself and the other me loose pearl: no, I will not turn on the air but the people upstairs will treat us bad. My option was to stay in the ice cream shop making time.
